ETYMOLOGY: Compound of 'ear' (from Old English ēare, from Proto-Germanic *auzon) and 'plug' (from Middle English plugge, from Middle Dutch or Middle Low German plugge).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A piece of soft material, such as wax, plastic, or silicone, inserted into the ear canal to block out noise or prevent water from entering.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种由蜡、塑料或硅胶等软材料制成的物品，塞入耳道以阻挡噪音或防止水进入。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He always wears earplugs when he sleeps to block out the street noise.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他睡觉时总是戴耳塞，以隔绝街上的噪音。
